pages.text: The path between the towers is the issue into the unknown.$(br)  The servile dog and savage wolf are the fears of the natural mind in that penumbral place of exit, when there is only reflected light to guide it.$(br)  The card represents life of the imagination apart from life of the spirit.$(br)  The intellectual light is a reflection and beyond it is the unknown mystery which it cannot show forth. It illuminates our animal nature,

types of which are represented below - the dog, the wolf and the crayfish which comes up out of the deeps, the nameless and hideous tendency which is lower than the savage beast.$(br)  It strives to attain manifestation, symbolized by crawling from the abyss of water to the land, but as a rule it sinks back whence it came.$(br)  The face of The Moon directs a mindful gaze upon the unrest below; the dew of thought falls;the message is: Peace, be still.

And it may be that there shall come a calm upon the animal nature, while the abyss beneath shall cease from giving up a form.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Instinct, wildness. Whatever is primal or deeply mysterious.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Resisting our own instinctive natures.$(br)  Feeling disturbed by our emotions or fantasies.
